sentence.Network_en: I got a bottle of my best malt out of the sideboard.
sentence.Network_cn: 我从餐具柜里取出一瓶自己收藏的最好的麦芽威士忌。

sentence.Network_en: Castle went to the sideboard and poured himself a whisky.
sentence.Network_cn: 卡斯尔走到餐柜前面,给自己斟了杯威士忌.

sentence.Network_en: He went to the sideboard and poured himself a whisky.

Mrs. Ainsworth's home was lavishly decorated with tinsel and holly , rows of drinks the sideboard and the rich aroma of turkey and and-onion stuffing wafted from the kitchen .安斯沃思太太的家铺张地用金银箔和冬青装饰着，餐具柜上摆着成排的酒水，火鸡和撒尔维亚干叶加葱头填料的浓郁香味自厨房扑鼻而来。

entry.def: A sideboard is a long cupboard which is about the same height as a table. Sideboards are usually kept in dining rooms to put plates and glasses in.
Sideboards are the same as sideburns .

means.word_mean: 1. a removable board fitted on the side of a wagon to increase its capacity
2. a board that forms part of the side of a bed or crib
3. a piece of furniture that stands at the side of a dining room; has shelves and drawers
